data.title: The Arizona Daily Star noted at the opening of the new plant that the building “reflects modern building styles for the desert.” The...
data.meta_description:
269 likes, 4 comments - sosbrutalism on February 9, 2024: "The Arizona Daily Star noted at the opening of the new plant that the building “reflects modern building styles for the desert.” The repetitive structural elements made of concrete provide shade and were a design response to the hot climate in the area. ⁠
⁠
Cain Nelson Ware & Cook: United States Post Office, Tucson, Arizona, USA, 1970–1972⁠
⁠
https://sosbrutalism.org/cms/18574376 ⁠
⁠
Photo: Jude Ignacio and Gerardine Vargas for Tucson Historic Preservation Foundation ⁠
⁠
#tucson⁠
#SOSBrutalism #brutalism #brutalist #brutalist_architecture #concrete #brut #betonbrut #rawconcrete".
